description:
Manager, Research Services
   
   
     Description
    
      Reporting to the Vice Chair (VC) of Research, the Manager, Research Services is responsible for a positive work culture, the development, implementation, and maintenance of work practices to permit the delivery of high-quality and efficient research coordination services while building excellence and capacity to respond to the research portfolio within the Department of Medicine (DoM). This includes managing a team, the administration and distribution of workload, communicating across teams, and performing quality control and assurance activities as required. The Manager develops processes and procedures, ensures fair and equitable access to resources, and identifies and addresses opportunities to improve processes and support and facilitate projects and communication to increase research productivity and impact.
    
   
   
     Responsibilities
    
     
      
        (This is not a complete list):
      
     
     
       Work with the VC of Research, the VC of Member Support, and Technical Solutions Office (TSO) to develop and maintain an online “hub” for researchers to navigate the complexity of the researcher environment
       Ensures equity in accessing Office services and resources
       Manages the staff of the Research Office, prioritizes and delegates workload to meet multiple demands, ensuring deadlines are met; provides guidance/training/coaching to Research Office employees
       Provide operational support to Vice-Chair of Research, including preparing and managing the annual Office budget
       Monitors the Office’s programs and service offerings and makes appropriate recommendations to capitalize on opportunities, mitigate risk, and resolve issues
       Build and maintain productive and supportive relationships to facilitate research within DOM
       Provide advice and guidance on funding opportunities, complex REB submissions, ethics proposals, publications, etc.
       Manage compliance, limitations, and maintenance of the internal research output measurement system
       Coordinate operational support for the Research Plus Program and the Director, Medical Education Research
       Works to develop strategies to increase the visibility of DoM’s research accomplishments and promote research events and activities
     
    
   
   
     Qualifications
    
     
       Minimum of 7 years of experience in clinical research at an academic hospital is strongly preferred, including but not limited to clinical trial management, and academic-led studies.
       Familiarity with scientometrics
       Experience with research ethics guidelines, applications and REB requirements
       Familiarity with concepts of The San Francisco Declaration on Research Assessment (DORA)
       Demonstrated relevant clinical research knowledge
       A minimum of 5 years supervisory/management experience
       Working knowledge of clinical research standards and regulations governing human research ethics
       Ability to set priorities, work under pressure and meet deadlines with an attention to detail
       Experience in leadership, mentoring, and creating positive working relationships, demonstrating tact and diplomacy
       Experiencing with managing a budgets and metric reporting
       Ability to handle highly sensitive and confidential information
       Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
       Client service oriented, with the ability to work effectively in a highly diverse environment
       Ability to exercise judgement and make decisions while working with minimal supervision
       Proficiency in speaking and comprehending both English and French (Level B+) is an asset
     
    
   
   
     Contacts
    
      To apply for this exciting opportunity, please forward your resume and cover letter, quoting the corresponding position title, by email at domcareers@toh.ca
      IMPORTANT NOTICE: Support staff are employees of the University of Ottawa Medical Associates. The Ottawa Hospital is the paymaster of our employees. Although our employees have offices within the Ottawa Hospital, they are not employed by the Ottawa Hospital. Please note, all employees must provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination prior to hire.
      The University of Ottawa Medical Associates is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees. The University of Ottawa Medical Associates will, upon request, provide accommodations in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
     Hiring organization
   
   
   
    
      Employment Type
    
    
      Full-time
    
   
   
    
      Duration of employment
    
    
      Permanent
    
   
   
    
      Industry
    
    
      Healthcare
    
   
   
    
      Job Location
    
    
      501 Smyth Road, Ottawa, ON, Ontario, Canada
    
   
   
    
      Base Salary
    
    
      $55.872-$69.167
      Per hour
    
   
   
    
     
      
        Valid through
      
      
        February 10, 2024
